Who's looking after our Docker images after all? @Herb was it you that raised your hand for that task? ...reason I'm asking is https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4747

empty configuration directory when attempting docker install 路 Issue #4747 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
When I attempt to start a docker instance of backdrop, I get an error similar to the following: Exception: The configuration directory in settings.php is specified as './files/config_a1614e8130...
@klonos I was just volunteering for the update. I don't use the docker image so not really sure how it all fits together

I've been working on getting backdrop running in docker, and I've managed to get it working but I'd like Backdrops "Database configuration" page to be pre-populated during the installation process and I'm looking for suggestions on how to approach this please?

https://hub.docker.com/r/kgolding/backdrop

I'm not familiar with Docker, but I know that Lando does this by setting the BACKDROP_SETTINGS environment variable... See https://github.com/lando/lando/blob/master/plugins/lando-recipes/recipes/backdrop/builder.js and https://api.backdropcms.org/api/backdrop/core%21includes%21bootstrap.inc/function/backdrop_settings_initialize/1

lando/lando
A development tool for all your projects that is fast, easy, powerful and liberating - lando/lando
Note however that this approach bypasses the database configuration step of the installer, not just prepopulates it...
